meanings.definition: A group or series of three.
meanings.sent1: The trine of friends enjoyed playing together.
meanings.sent2: The trine of colors in the flag symbolized unity.
meanings.sent3: The trine of kittens napped in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The trine of stars shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The trine of musketeers embarked on a daring adventure.

meanings.definition: To put into the form of a trine; to arrange in threefold order.
meanings.sent1: She would trine the flowers in a beautiful bouquet.
meanings.sent2: He decided to trine the books on the shelf for better organization.
meanings.sent3: The chef would trine the ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent4: The artist would trine the colors on the canvas for a harmonious effect.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would trine the students into groups for a class activity.

meanings.sent1: She would trine the cake into equal slices for everyone.
meanings.sent2: He needed to trine the budget to allocate funds properly.
meanings.sent3: The magician would trine the scarf into three pieces during the trick.
meanings.sent4: The gardener would trine the garden into sections for different plants.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic would trine the engine into components for repair.
